intro: Stillingia thouarsiana, commonly known as the Pacific island stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Ocean. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Stillingia thouarsiana is typically found in coastal or forested areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climates of its native habitat.
